intro: Campylanthus pungens, commonly known as the spiny campylanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, spiny stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, blue to purple flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
